purchase_instructions: 要购买此板的副本，请访问mycoughdrop.com并通过网站购买。 [[ To purchase a copy of this board, go to mycoughdrop.com and purchase via the website.
a_little_about_aac: 首先，关于AAC的一些知识 [[ First, A Little About AAC
aac_intro_1: 感谢您注册%app_name%！我们很高兴您在这里，希望％app_name％有所作为。在深入了解％app_name％基础知识之前，我们想先谈谈AAC。 [[ Thanks for signing up for %app_name%! We're excited you're here and hope %app_name% makes a difference. Before we get into some %app_name% basics, we wanted to talk a little about AAC.
aac_intro_2: AAC（增补性和替代性交流）是一种工具，可以帮助发展交流者。 %app_name%是AAC的一种，您可以选择代表单词或字母的按钮，而设备会说出用户选择的内容。 [[ AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) is a tool to help developing communicators be heard. %app_name% is a type of AAC where you select buttons that represent words or letters and the device speaks whatever the user selects.
aac_intro_22: AAC可以给那些难以独自讲话的人带来巨大的改变。理想情况下，用户可以从词典中的任何单词中进行选择，但是如果不能选择拼写，我们需要仔细选择正确的单词和短语，以最好地帮助每个人有效地进行交流。 [[ AAC can make a huge difference for people who have a hard time speaking on their own. Ideally users could pick from any word in the dictionary, but if spelling isn't an option, we need to carefully choose the right words and phrases to best help each individual communicate effectively.
aac_intro_3: 在%app_name%中，我们将单词和短语放在按“面板”集合组织的按钮上。针对许多不同的用户和需求，有不同的板组。 [[ In %app_name% we put words and phrases on buttons that are organized as a collection of "boards". There are different board sets for many different users and needs.
choosing_vocabulary: 选择正确的词汇 [[ Choosing the Right Vocabulary
aac_core_words: AAC核心词汇 [[ AAC Core Words
core_words_1: 用正确的词开始用户很重要-而且很辛苦！您如何确定某人应该动用哪些词？ [[ Starting a user with the right words is important -- and hard! How do you decide which words someone should have at their fingertips?
core_words_2: 许多人首先考虑基于需求的交流（“我需要去洗手间”，“我很伤心”，“我饿了”），这些都是可以表达的重要内容。但是，尝试包含可以以多种方式使用的常用单词也非常有价值。我们称这些类型的单词为“核心”单词。 [[ Many people think first about needs-based communication ("I need to go to the bathroom", "I am hurting", "I am hungry"), and these are important things to be able to express. However, it's also very valuable to try to include common words that can be used in more than one way. We call these types of words "core" words.
core_words_3: 核心词是诸如“ you”，“ I”，“ like”，“ not”，“ go”，“ in”等之类的词。它们可能似乎并不立即有用，但是随着时间的流逝，接触核心的用户单词可以表达许多不同的想法（“我喜欢”，“不想要”，“得到它”，“什么时候可以去那里”），并且可以更有效地加深他们的词汇量。 [[ Core words are words like "you", "I", "like", "not", "go", "in", etc. They may not seem as useful right away, but over time a user who is exposed to core words can express many different ideas ("I like it", "not want", "you get it", "when can we go there") and more effectively deepen their vocabulary.
core_words_4: 每个用户都是不同的，但是核心和专门的单词和短语的组合通常可以帮助沟通者逐渐增加其表达，而不会仅仅因为表达需求和欲望而陷入困境。 [[ Every user is different, but a combination of core and specialized words and phrases can often help a communicator grow their expression gradually, instead of being stuck only expressing needs and wants.
selecting_a_home_board: 选择主板 [[ Selecting a Home Board
home_board_1: %app_name%具有许多不同的主板，您可以立即开始使用它们，也可以在复制时进行个性化设置。有些主板有一些大按钮，有些则有许多小按钮。 [[ %app_name% has a number of different home boards that you can start using right away, or copy and personalize as you go. Some boards have a few large buttons, and some have many small buttons.
home_board_2: 更多的按钮意味着更多的表达方式，但是一些用户在他们可以可靠按下的按钮上受到限制（请记住，现在您始终可以隐藏按钮，稍后再添加，因此看起来“太忙”的面板可能实际上是随着时间的推移它们可以成长为某种东西） [[ More buttons means more options for expression, but some users are limited in how small a button they can reliably hit (keep in mind you can always hide buttons for now that you want to add later, so a board that looks "too busy" may actually be something they can grow into over time).
speak_mode_2: 当您处于朗读模式时，您可以点击按钮进行朗读，然后将其添加到顶部的发声框中。如果您点击发声框，它将说出那里的所有按钮。退格键和清除按钮可以帮助保持句子窗口的清洁。 [[ When you're in Speak Mode you can hit buttons to have them spoken, and added to the vocalization box at the top. If you hit the vocalization box it'll speak all the buttons that are located there. The backspace and clear buttons can help keep the sentence window clean.
app_speak_mode_folders: %app_name%语音模式文件夹 [[ %app_name% Speak Mode Folders
speak_mode_22: 在按钮上带有小文件夹图标的按钮是链接的按钮，这意味着如果选择它们，将带您进入另一个板。这样一来，您可以拥有多个级别，并且单词和短语比单个屏幕上显示的更多。您总是可以通过单击“主页”按钮回到第一板。 [[ Buttons that have a little folder icon on them are linked buttons, which means that if you select them it will take you to another board. This lets you have multiple levels, with more words and phrases than could fit on a single screen. You can always get back to the first board by hitting the home button.
app_exiting_speak_mode: %app_name%退出朗读模式 [[ %app_name% Exiting Speak Mode
speak_mode_3: 您可以通过点击右上角的用户菜单退出语音模式。如果您担心用户自己意外退出语音模式，则可以在用户首选项中设置PIN。 [[ You can exit out of Speak Mode by hitting the user menu in the top right corner. If you're worried about a user accidentally exiting Speak Mode on their own, you can set up a PIN in the user's preferences.
intro_modeling_3: 在%app_name%中，沟通者周围的支持团队称为“主管”。主管是为通讯员建模并与其一起工作的用户。他们具有自己的登录名，并且可能是老师或理疗师，父母，照料者等。 [[ In %app_name%, the support team around the communicator are called "supervisors". Supervisors are users that are modeling for and working with a communicator. They have their own login, and might be a teacher or a therapist, a parent, a caregiver, etc.
intro_modeling_4: 主管将添加到他们的沟通者帐户中，并且可以在自己的设备上看到沟通者的面板，因此他们可以适应用户的词汇表以更好地建模，并且可以在拥有编辑权限的情况下添加新的按钮和短语。 [[ Supervisors are added to their communicator's account, and can see a communicator's boards on their own devices, so they can get comfortable with a user's vocabulary for better modeling, and can add new buttons and phrases if they have editing permission.
logging_and_report: 记录和报告 [[ Logging and Reports
reports_1: 主管还可以查看用户的通信历史记录。出于隐私原因，默认情况下禁用日志和报告，但是如果启用它们，则用户的主管可以查看其通信随时间的进展情况。 [[ Supervisors can also review a user's communication history. For privacy reasons logs and reports are disabled by default, but if you enable them then the user's supervisors can see how their communication is progressing over time.
reports_2: 除了查看使用历史记录之外，主管还可以访问每个通信会话的详细报告，并可以与用户团队进行记录并共享注释，因此每个人都知道当前的策略是什么以及什么方法行之有效。 [[ In addition to reviewing usage history, supervisors can access detailed reports on each communication session, and can make and share notes with the user's team, so everyone knows what the current strategy is and what is or isn't working well.

support_site: %app_name%支持网站，包括常见问题解答 [[ %app_name% Support Site, with FAQs
thanks_continue_learning: 感谢您阅读%app_name%的简介！希望它对您有所帮助！如果您有疑问或想了解更多信息，可以查看一些其他资源。 [[ Thanks for going through this introduction to %app_name%! Hopefully it was helpful for you! If you have questions or want to learn more, you can check out some additional resources.
more_resources_2: 如果您迷路了，可以随时单击仪表板底部的“支持”按钮寻求帮助，或分享有关我们如何改善%app_name%的反馈。我们随时为您提供帮助！ [[ If you ever get lost you can always hit the "Support" button at the bottom of the dashboard to ask for help, or to share feedback on how we can improve %app_name%. We're always here to help!

always_available_boards: 始终可用的板 [[ Always-Available Boards
offline_boards_explainer: 以下是我们与合作伙伴一起提供的免费且始终可用的紧急和关键用途板的集合。任何下载%app_name%应用程序的人，无论有没有互联网连接，都可以访问这些板。 [[ Below is a collection of free and always-available emergency and critical-use boards that we provide along with our partners. Anyone who downloads the %app_name% app will have access to these boards, with or without an Internet connection.

user_search_results: 用户搜索结果 [[ User Search Results
have_you_tried_modeling: 您尝试过建模吗？ [[ Have You Tried Modeling?
modeling_intro_1: 学习使用AAC词汇非常类似于学习新语言。当您周围的人也使用它时，它要容易得多！您可以通过建模来提供帮助，该示例显示了如何使用它的示例（“您可以这样说”，然后您自己按一下按钮）。有时候，在交流者效仿您的示例之前，需要进行大量建模，因此请耐心等待！ [[ Learning to use an AAC vocabulary is a lot like learning a new language. It's much easier when the people around you use it too! You can help by modeling, which is showing examples of how to us it ("here's how you could say this" and then hit the buttons yourself). Sometimes it takes a lot of modeling before a communicator follows your example, so try to be patient!
modeling_intro_2: 进行建模时，您需要确保处于建模模式，因此%app_name%可以告诉您语音与沟通者之间的区别。您可以在仪表板上为通信器“建模”，也可以点按“清除”按钮三次以暂时进入建模模式。试试看，亲自看看！ [[ When modeling you'll want to make sure you're in modeling mode, so %app_name% can tell the difference between your speech and the communicator's. You can "model for" a communicator in your dashboard, or you can triple-tap the clear button to temporarily go into modeling mode. Give it a try and see for yourself!
thanks_app: 感谢您在网络浏览器中尝试%app_name%！这是一个您正在网站中看到的演示，因此它仅限于语音模式，但是如果您访问该网站，则应该能够照常访问帐户。 [[ Thanks for trying %app_name% in your web browser! This is a demo you're seeing embedded in a web site, so it's limited to speak mode only, but if you visit the web site you should be able to access your account as usual.
thanks_app_long: 感谢您在网络浏览器中尝试%app_name%！这是一个您正在网站中看到的演示，但是％app_name％是一款功能强大的增强通信（AAC）应用，可以在桌面浏览器中作为其自己的选项卡运行，也可以在平板电脑和智能手机。您可以注册免费试用版，看看它是否适合您或您认识的人！ [[ Thanks for trying %app_name% in your web browser! This is a demo you're seeing embedded in a web site, but %app_name% is a powerful augmentative communication (AAC) app that can run as it's own tab in a browser on a desktop, or be downloaded in app stores on tablets and smartphones. You can sign up for a free trial and see if it will work for you or someone you know!
back_to_demo: 返回演示 [[ Back to the Demo
contact_us_intro: 问题？有什么建议吗？ ku句？我们希望听到您的任何声音！我们的目标是建立一种资源，为沟通者及其周围的团队提供支持，以便我们帮助人们表达自己的声音。没有您的帮助和参与，我们几乎无法做到这一点，所以请给我们打个电话！ [[ Questions? Suggestions? Haikus? We'd love to hear any of them from you! Our goal is to build a resource that supports communicators and the teams around them so we can help people's voices be heard. We can't do that nearly as well without help and participation from you, so please send us a line!

invalid_code: 找不到代码为 _TR1B _ 的可用礼物。该代码可能已被兑换，或者输入的代码不正确。请联系提供者并确认详细信息。 [[ No available gift was found for the code %{code}. It's possible the code has already been redeemed, or the code was entered incorrectly. Please contact the giver and confirm the details.

app_partners_and_supported_integrations: %app_name%合作伙伴和支持的集成 [[ %app_name% Partners and Supported Integrations
compatibility_intro: %app_name%致力于与其他公司和组织合作，为传播者提供最佳体验。这是我们提供的一些合作伙伴和兼容资源。 [[ %app_name% is committed to working with other companies and organizations to provide communicators with the best possible experience. Here are some of the partners and compatible resources we have available.
community_partners_explainer: 社区合作伙伴是技术和支持合作伙伴，它们提供辅助技术资源和工具，也可以使某些沟通者及其支持团队更有效地使用TR1A。 [[ Community partners are technical and support partners that provide assistive technology resources and tools that can also make %app_name% usage more effective for some communicators and their support teams.
frs_explainer: 福布斯AAC与保险公司合作，为其ProSlate专用平板电脑提供了预安装%app_name%的资金。 [[ Forbes AAC works with insurance to get their ProSlate dedicated tablet funded with %app_name% pre-installed.
ablenet_explainer: AbleNet与保险公司合作，获得预安装%app_name%资助的QuickTalker FreeStyle专用平板电脑。 [[ AbleNet works with insurance to get their QuickTalker FreeStyle dedicated tablet funded with %app_name% pre-installed.
acapela_explainer: Acapela为语音生成提供优质的合成语音。 Acapela在%app_name%支持iOS，Android和Windows。 [[ Acapela provides premium synthesized voices for speech generation. Acapela voices in %app_name% for iOS, Android and Windows.
switch_explainer: %app_name%的内置开关激活的扫描功能可以使用一个或两个开关动作。大多数（如果不是全部）蓝牙开关都应该通过键盘仿真与％app_name％一起使用，并且在Windows上，也可以根据用户的喜好配置其他键盘样式的开关。 [[ %app_name%'s built-in switch-activated scanning will work with one or two switch actions. Most if not all bluetooth switches should work with %app_name% via keyboard emulation, and on Windows other keyboard-style switches can also be configured in a user's preferences.
blue2_explainer: Blue2开关可与移动设备和Windows设备配合使用，并提供一键和两键开关控制 [[ The Blue2 switch worked with mobile and Windows devices and provides one and two-button switch control
eye_trackers_explainer: 在Windows设备上，您可以下载并安装%app_name%应用，以将％app_name％与硬件眼动仪配合使用。目前，某些眼动仪（EyeX和EyeTribe）具有本机集成，而其他眼动仪（Tobii，myGaze，eyetech等）在光标模式下可以很好地运行。可以根据用户的喜好配置诸如停留时间和激活距离之类的设置。 [[ On Windows devices, you can download and install the %app_name% app to use %app_name% with hardware eye trackers. Some eye trackers (EyeX and EyeTribe) currently have native integrations, while others (Tobii, myGaze, eyetech, etc.) work very well running in cursor mode. Settings like dwell time and activation distance can be configured in a user's preferences.
head_pointers_and_mice: 头指针和鼠标 [[ Head Pointers and Mice
head_mouse_explainer: Windows上的鼠标光标可以由许多不同类型的界面控制，包括一些标题指针和鼠标头工具。可以使用%app_name%的内置驻留跟踪来配置这些应用和设备，该跟踪可在Windows％app_name％应用中获得。 [[ The mouse cursor on Windows can be controlled by many different kinds of interface, including some header pointers and head mouse tools. These apps and devices can be configured using %app_name%'s built-in dwell tracking, available in the Windows %app_name% app.
camera_mouse_explainer: Camera Mouse是一个免费的头部跟踪Windows应用程序，它使用计算机的摄像头来控制鼠标光标。 [[ Camera Mouse is a free head-tracking Windows app that uses the computer's camera to control the mouse cursor.
bluetooth_speakers_explainer: 有些设备的扬声器声音不够大，或者扬声器指向的方向错误，因此无法帮助沟通者有效地讲话。蓝牙扬声器可以与%app_name%一起使用，以促进通信，甚至可以使使用％app_name％更加有趣。 [[ Some devices don't have loud enough speakers, or have speakers that point the wrong direction so they don't help a communicator speak effectively. Bluetooth speakers can be used with %app_name% to facilitate communication, and even to make using %app_name% just a little more fun.
clipster_explainer: ION Clipster是一款夹式蓝牙扬声器，可以连接到设备并提供更大的音量，并从通信器中直接输出声音。 [[ ION Clipster is a clip-on bluetooth speaker that can connect to devices and provide additional volume and direct sound out in from of the communicator.
bluebee_explainer: 蓝蜂好朋友是可爱的毛绒动物，带有内置的蓝牙扬声器，说话时嘴巴会移动。它们可以成为开发交流者的绝佳加强工具。 [[ Bluebee Pals are cute stuffed animals with a built-in bluetooth speaker whose mouths move as they speak. They can be a great reinforcement tool for developing communicators.
keyguard_explainer: 对于某些用户而言，很难将手指放在正确的按钮上。键盘锁可以帮助他们导航到正确的位置，一些公司可以为几乎任何%app_name%主板配置创建自定义键盘锁。 [[ For some users it can be hard to get their fingers down on the right buttons. Keyguards can help them navigate to the right place, and some companies can create custom keyguards for just about any %app_name% board configuration.
lasered_pics_explainer: Lasered Pics可以为许多不同的平板电脑和设备创建自定义键盘锁。通过从设备向他们发送屏幕截图，他们可以支持许多%app_name%配置。 [[ Lasered Pics can create custom keyguards for many different tablets and devices. By sending them a screenshot from the device they can support many %app_name% configurations.
frs_keyguards_explainer: 福布斯AAC可以为与其ProSlate专用平板电脑配合使用的%app_name%不同配置创建自定义键盘锁。 [[ Forbes AAC can create custom keyguards for different %app_name% configurations that work with their ProSlate dedicated tablets.

You can add contacts on a user's profile under My Account!

ios_head_tracking: Apple Face ID 的内置功能支持原生头部跟踪。对于没有 Face ID 的设备，将使用基于摄像头的头部跟踪器。 [[ The built-in features of Apple Face ID support native head tracking. For devices without Face ID a camera-based head tracker will be used.
supported_head_trackers: 一些设备支持硬件优化头部跟踪作为 AR 工具集的一部分，对于所有其他设备，将使用基于摄像头的头部跟踪器。 [[ Some devices support hardware-optimized head tracking as part of AR toolsets, for all other devices a camera-based head tracker will be used.

external_device_enter_log_explainer: 对于使用第三方设备或应用程序的传播者，您可以手动输入该用户的日志，以使%app_name%的报告和目标跟踪功能生效。为此，只需输入通讯器使用的单词或短语，每行按一个“按钮”即可。 [[ For communicators using a third-party device or app, you can manually enter logs for that user to allow for %app_name%'s reporting and goal tracking features to take effect. To do so, just enter the words or phrases the communicator used, with one "button" press per line.

profiles_explainer: 通信配置文件是评估工具，可用于评估或监控用户的通信发展。配置文件可以针对沟通者或与他们一起工作的人，并且可以多次运行。他们可以帮助确定用户的适当目标，并可以帮助团队协调有效的支持策略。 [[ Communication Profiles are evaluation tools that can be used to assess or monitor a user's communication development. Profiles can target communicators or the people who work with them, and can be run multiple times. They can help with deciding on appropriate goals for a user and can help teams coordinate on effective strategies for support.
profiles_explainer_2: 注意：配置文件应始终在用户参与的情况下运行，即使他们的参与可能受到限制。此外，个人资料绝不应用作“证据”，证明某人不应获得全面的沟通支持或适合年龄的学习经验。 [[ NOTE: Profiles should always be run with the user's involvement, even if their participation may be limited. Also, profiles should never be used as "proof" that someone shouldn't receive full communication supports or age-appropriate learning experiences.

focus_words_explainer: Focus Words 是一种工具，可让您更轻松地访问与特定主题或活动有关的单词子集。焦点词不是创建一个单独的特定于上下文的词汇表副本，而是允许传播者和支持者了解相关词在传播者的默认词汇表中的位置。 [[ Focus Words is a tool for prividing easier access to the subset of words that have to do with a specific topic or activity. Rather than creating a separate context-specific copy of the vocabulary, Focus Words allows communicators and supporters to learn the location of relevant words in the communicator's default vocabulary.
focus_words_explainer2: 您可以通过输入共享阅读书的文本、与特定活动相关的单词等来使用焦点词。您还可以浏览社区的焦点词集或保存自己的焦点词集以便快速访问。 [[ You can use Focus Words by entering the text of a shared reading book, words related to a specific activity, etc. You can also browse the community's collection of Focus Word sets or save your own for quick access.

grid_size_suggestion_prompt: 这种板样式有多种网格尺寸。当您选择网格大小时，请尝试关注用户可以可靠点击的最小按钮，而不是担心显示太多按钮。多按钮网格可以“调低”以显示更少的按钮，这比调整少数按钮网格以稍后添加更多按钮更容易。 [[ This board style has multiple grid sizes. As you choose a grid size, try to focus on the smallest buttons that the user can reliably hit, rather than worrying about showing too many buttons. A many-button grid can be "turned down" to show fewer buttons more easily than a few-button grid can be adjusted to add more buttons later.

user_trainings_explainer: 组织经理可以为您的利益和进步定义继续教育培训。添加培训后，它们将显示在用户的仪表板上及其培训列表中。每次培训都可以启动，然后在完成后进行评级，以提供反馈并跟踪使用情况。组织可以利用这些培训来帮助每个人培养技能和知识，从而帮助他们最好地支持 AAC 用户。 [[ Organization managers can define continuing education trainings for your benefit and improvement. When trainings have been added they will appear on a user's dashboard and here on their list of trainings. Each training can be launched, and then rated once completed to provide feedback and to track usage. Organizations can use these trainings to help everyone develop the skills and knowledge that can help them best support AAC users.
valet_as_classroom2: 教室登录可在教室环境中使用，以允许在同一教室中同时在多个设备上进行仅讲话模式访问 [[ Classroom login can be used in a classroom setting to allow speak-mode-only access on multiple devices at the same time in the same classroom
classroom_login_explainer: 课堂登录允许您共享备用用户名和密码，从而允许在多个设备（例如在教室中）上以仅发言模式访问帐户。当有人使用您的教室登录名时，该设备将只能访问论坛和用户首选项，类似于仅限建模的帐户。 [[ Classroom login allows you to share an alternative username and password that allows speak-mode-only access to the account across multiple devices, such as in a classroom. When someone uses your classroom login, that device will have access to boards and user preferences only, similar to a modeling-only account.
classroom_user_name: 课堂用户名 [[ Classroom User Name
valet_as_classroom: 此外，可以在教室环境中使用代客登录，以允许在同一教室中同时在多个设备上进行仅讲话模式访问 [[ Additionally, a valet login can be used in a classroom setting to allow speak-mode-only access on multiple devices at the same time in the same classroom

already_home_board: 接下来，我们很乐意帮助您设置主板。您似乎已经选择了一个，因此可以跳过此步骤，除非您想设置不同的主板 [[ Next we'd be happy to help you set up a home board. It looks like you've already got one selected, so you can skip this step unless you'd like to set up a different home board

This information will be passed to third-party research groups through OpenAAC.org, and NOT stored on %app_name% servers or as part of the user's %app_name% profile.

masquerade_rules: 组织管理员可以临时以其组织内的用户身份登录，而无需用户密码。但这个资源不应该轻易使用。在继续之前，请记住保护用户的私人信息，并且仅将此工具用于支持或培训目的。完成后，您可以点击菜单中的“停止伪装”返回到我们自己的帐户。 [[ Organization managers can temporarily log in as users within their organization without needing the user's password. But this resource should not be used lightly. Before you continue, remember to keep the user's private information protected, and to only use this tool for support or training purposes. When you are finished, you can hit "Stop Masquerading" in the menu to return to our own account.
masquerade agreement: 我同意仅将此伪装工具用于支持或培训目的，并尊重用户信息的隐私。 [[ I agree only to use this masquerading tool for support or training purposes, and to respect the privacy of the user's information.

select_device_pref: 每个沟通者都应该使用最适合他们的解决方案 - 无论他们使用的是应用程序还是其他东西，%app_name% 都可以提供帮助。选择用户当前的主要 AAC 解决方案和访问方法，以帮助保持一切最新且准确。 [[ Every communicator should use the solution that works best for them -- and %app_name% can help whether they're using the app or something else. Select the user's current primary AAC solution and access method to help keep everything up-to-date and accurate.

start_code_link_explainer: 以下链接可以与新用户共享。您可以保存下面的二维码以嵌入其他资源，或将注册链接直接复制到剪贴板。当用户点击该链接时，将自动为其生成启动代码。 [[ The following link can be shared with new users. You can save the QR code below to embed in additional resources, or copy the registration link directly to your clipboard. When users follow that link, the start code will be automatically generated for them.

start_codes_user_explainer: 起始代码是唯一的代码，您可以与 %app_name% 的新用户共享。当他们注册时，他们可以选择输入起始代码，如果他们这样做，那么他们会自动看到您添加为主管。您还可以选择为它们设置一些首选项，例如默认的起始板。 [[ Start codes are unique codes you can share with users who are new to %app_name%. When they sign up they can optionally enter a start code, and if they do, then they will automatically see you added as a supervisor. You can also optionally set some preferences for them, like a default starting board.
start_codes_org_explainer: 起始代码是唯一的代码，您可以与 %app_name% 的新用户共享。当他们注册时，他们可以选择输入起始代码，如果他们这样做，那么他们将自动添加到您的组织中。您还可以选择为它们设置一些首选项，例如默认的起始板，并且将为每个使用起始代码的用户设置这些设置。 [[ Start codes are unique codes you can share with users who are new to %app_name%. When they sign up they can optionally enter a start code, and if they do, then they will automatically be added to your organization. You can also optionally set some preferences for them, like a default starting board, and these settings will be set for each user who uses the start code.
